trans-unit.source: An inline-level flow content element that provides facilities for hosting hyperlinks within flow content.

Hyperlink implements the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.NavigateUri%2A> property that you set with the <xref:System.Uri> of the content that should be navigated to when the Hyperlink is clicked.

Hyperlink navigation can only occur, however, if either the direct or indirect parent of a Hyperlink is a navigation host, including <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Frame>, or any browser that can host [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xbap#plural](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xbapsharpplural-md.md)] (which includes [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ie7](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-ie7-md.md)], [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ie6](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-ie6-md.md)], and Firefox 2.0+).
For more information, see the **Navigation Hosts** topic in [Navigation Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Hyperlink enforces a strong content model for child content.
See [TextElement Content Model Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for more information about the Hyperlink content model.
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Initializes a new, default instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref> class, taking a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> object as the initial contents of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> object specifying the initial contents of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref> class, taking a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> object as the initial contents of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>, and a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> specifying an insertion position for the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> object specifying the initial contents of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
This parameter may be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, in which case no <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> is inserted.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> specifying an insertion position at which to insert the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref> element after it is created, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> for no automatic insertion.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref> class, taking two <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> objects that indicate the beginning and end of a selection of content to be contained by the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
This constructor is intended to initialize a new <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink> element such that it encloses a selection of preexisting content.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> indicating the beginning of a selection of content to be contained by the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> indicating the end of a selection of content to be contained by the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
start or end is .
start and end do not resolve to a range of content suitable for enclosure by a element; for example, if start and end indicate positions in different paragraphs.
Gets or sets a base URI for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
A base URI for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
Occurs when the left mouse button is clicked on a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate||
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.Click"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Gets or sets a command to associate with the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A command to associate with the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets command parameters associated with the command specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.Command*> property.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
An object specifying parameters for the command specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.Command*> property.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.CommandParameter*> dependency property.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.Command*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a target element on which to execute the command specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.Command*> property.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A target element on which to execute the command specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.Command*> property.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.CommandTarget*> dependency property.
To be added.
Simulates the act of a user clicking the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
Calling this method is equivalent to a user clicking the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink>.
Gets a value that indicates whether or not the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref> is enabled.
This property overrides <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsEnabledCore%2A>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref> is enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] to navigate to when the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref> is activated.
To link to a particular inline element, specify the element name preceded by a pound symbol (#).

When a user hovers the mouse over a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink> in an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xbap](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] stored in the NavigateUri property is displayed in the status bar.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink> navigates to this [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] when the user clicks the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink>.

If the value of the NavigateUri property changes after the user clicks the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink> and before the subsequent navigation request, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink> ignores the new value of the NavigateUri property and navigates to the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] that was the value of the NavigateUri property when the user clicked the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink>.
> [!NOTE] > You are not restricted to only using a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink> to do navigation.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage.NavigateUri%2A> attached property as well, but only from the following: <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>, <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Path>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Canvas>, and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Glyphs>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref:System.Uri> to navigate to when the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref> is activated.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

<xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref> can navigate to the value of the NavigateUri property only if either the direct or indirect parent of a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref> is a navigation host, including <xref href="System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Frame"></xref>, or any browser that can host [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xbap#plural](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xbapsharpplural-md.md)] (which includes [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ie7](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-ie7-md.md)], [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ie6](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-ie6-md.md)], and Firefox 2.0+).
For more information, see the **Navigation Hosts** section in [Navigation Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.NavigateUri*> dependency property.
To be added.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.Click"></xref> routed event.

This method navigates to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.NavigateUri%2A> property, and marks the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] as visited.

> [!IMPORTANT] > Depending on the host computer's security configuration, certain forms of navigation (for example, navigating to a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_unc](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-unc-md.md)] path) are not allowed in the Internet zone.
In such cases, this method will demand full trust.
For more information, see [Code Access Security](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Creates and returns an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.OnCreateAutomationPeer%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.KeyDown"></xref> routed event.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.OnKeyDown%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Arguments associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.KeyDown"></xref> event.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseLeftButtonDown"></xref> routed event.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.OnMouseLeftButtonDown%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Arguments associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseLeftButtonDown"></xref> event.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseLeftButtonUp"></xref> routed event.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.OnMouseLeftButtonUp%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Arguments associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseLeftButtonUp"></xref> event.
Occurs when navigation events are requested.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate||
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.RequestNavigate"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Gets or sets a base URI for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
A base URI for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of a target window or frame for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
This property corresponds to the `TARGET` attribute of an [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_html](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-html-md.md)] hyperlink.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A string specifying the name of a target window or frame for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink.TargetName*> dependency property.
To be added.
